meanings.definition: To pay back money to someone who has spent it for you.
meanings.sent1: She reimbursed her friend for the movie tickets.
meanings.sent2: The company reimbursed me for my travel expenses.
meanings.sent3: He reimbursed his sister for the ice cream she bought him.
meanings.sent4: The kindness she showed was reimbursed with gratitude.
meanings.sent5: The act of reimbursing shows honesty and responsibility.

meanings.definition: To give money back to someone who has spent it for you.
meanings.sent1: They reimbursed their neighbor for the borrowed tools.
meanings.sent2: The store reimbursed the customer for the damaged product.
meanings.sent3: The cat reimbursed the owner for the knocked-over vase with a purr.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reimbursed him for all the hard work he put in.
meanings.sent5: The satisfaction of reimbursing others is fulfilling.
